title: Epsilon
text: Error tolerance is similar to the idea of how close $$x$$ must to a number if $$y$$ is epsilon away from another number.
speech: Error tolerance is similar to the idea of how close  x  must to a number if  y,  is epsilon away from another number.
pacedSpeech: Error tolerance is similar to the idea of how close   x
must to a number if   y,
is epsilon away from another number.

title: Delta
text: The corresponding accuracy is similar to how close our estimate of delta for $$x$$ if $$y$$ is epsilon units from another number.
speech: The corresponding accuracy is similar to how close our estimate of delta for  x  if  y,  is epsilon units from another number.
pacedSpeech: The corresponding accuracy is similar to how close our estimate of delta for   x
is epsilon units from another number.

title: "a" in this contex
text: a is what $$x$$, the side lengths, are approaching.
speech: a is what  x , the side lengths, are approaching.

title: "L" in this context
text: L is the maximum value the limit if approaching, which is similar to the maximum area.
speech: L is the maximum value the limit if approaching, which is similar to the maximum area.
pacedSpeech: L is the maximum value the limit if approaching, which is similar to the maximum area.
